messages.content: What is the ComfyUI-CoreMLSuite repository?
A set of custom nodes for ComfyUI that allows you to use Core ML models in your ComfyUI workflows.
How does using Core ML models enhance ComfyUI workflows?
They leverage the Apple Neural Engine (ANE) on Apple Silicon (M1/M2) machines, thereby enhancing your workflows and improving performance.
Where can I obtain Core ML models for the ComfyUI-CoreMLSuite?
You can download them from Hugging Face (https://huggingface.co/coreml-community) or convert your own models using coremltools (https://github.com/apple/ml-stable-diffusion).
How can I install custom nodes for the ComfyUI-CoreMLSuite manually?

1. Clone this repository into the custom_nodes directory of your ComfyUI.
2. Install the required dependencies using a package manager like pip.
What are the features of the custom nodes provided by the ComfyUI-CoreMLSuite?

Loading Core ML UNet models, Support for ControlNet, Support for ANE, Support for CPU and GPU, Support for mlppackage and mlmodelc files, Support for SDXL models, Support for LCM models, Support for LoRAs, SD1.5 to Core ML conversion, SDXL to Core ML conversion, and LCM to Core ML conversion.
Which hardware acceleration feature does ANE stand for in the context of ComfyUI-CoreMLSuite?
Apple Neural Engine, a hardware accelerator for machine learning tasks on Apple devices.
What is the default hardware on which the model will run in ComfyUI-CoreMLSuite?
CPU_AND_ANE, which allows the model to run on both the CPU and ANE.
What are the limitations of using Core ML models in ComfyUI-CoreMLSuite?
Core ML models are fixed in terms of their inputs and outputs, meaning you'll need to use latent images of the same size as the input of the model. SD2.1 models are not supported.
Where should I place the downloaded UNet model before using it with the ComfyUI-CoreMLSuite?
The downloaded UNet model should be placed in the ComfyUI's 'models/unet' directory.
How can I obtain support for the ComfyUI-CoreMLSuite?
You can open an issue in the repository or reach out to the maintainer directly for assistance.
